item.title: Creating a QUnit test harness for headless Chrome
item.description: When running acceptence tests in a continuous integration system, we often need some way to simulate a browser. For some time, PhantomJS has been the go-to option, thanks to its simple API and lightweight nature. Chrome 59 recently launched with support for “headless mode”: It’s a way to run the Chrome browser in a headless environment. Essentially, running Chrome without chrome! It brings all modern web platform features provided by Chromium and the Blink rendering engine to the command line.
